meanings.definition: State or quality of being turbulent.
meanings.sent1: The turbulency of the storm made it difficult to walk outside.
meanings.sent2: The ocean showed signs of turbulency as the waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was filled with turbulency as the students eagerly awaited the test results.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were in a state of turbulency, making it hard to focus on anything else.
meanings.sent5: The turbulency of emotions within her heart mirrored the storm brewing outside.

meanings.sent1: The plane experienced turbulency during the stormy flight.
meanings.sent2: The turbulency of the river made it challenging for the boat to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The dance performance was full of turbulency, with dancers moving energetically across the stage.
meanings.sent4: The turbulency of the car ride left her feeling queasy.
meanings.sent5: The turbulency of the wind shook the trees violently, scattering leaves everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The turbulency in the crowd grew as the concert start time approached.
meanings.sent2: The turbulency in her mind kept her awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The meeting ended in turbulency as different opinions clashed.
meanings.sent4: The turbulency of the argument left both parties feeling upset.
meanings.sent5: The turbulency of the situation caused chaos in the normally quiet town.
